Remark of president of Grand National Party assailed

Anniversary of June 10 anti-Japanese demonstration observed
articles.content:
"Koreans' European Solidarity" inaugurated 
    Pyongyang, June 10 (KCNA) -- The "Koreans' European Solidarity" formed in Germany reportedly made public its inaugural declaration on May 20.
 Recalling that various Koreans' organizations were formed in Japan, Americas and Germany to conduct energetic activities during the last period, the declaration noted that the organization was inaugurated to group all the democratic organizations and personages in Europe in order to meet the need to develop the solidarity body.    
 The declaration said that the organization has taken its first giant stride to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country. it would wage a movement of compatriots to suit the specific conditions in countries they reside, defend the unity and democratic rights and interests of the compatriots and cooperate and strengthen solidarity with all the Koreans abroad desirous of national unity in the future, the declaration said.

articles.content:
Greetings to Libyan leader 
    Pyongyang, June 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today sent a message of greetings to moammer el gaddafi, leader of the Great September First Revolution of the great socialist people's Libyan Arab Jamahiriya, on the occasion of the 31st anniversary of the dismantling of the U.S. military base in Libya.
 The message expressed the belief that the excellent friendly and cooperative relations forged between the two countries would grow stronger in the future and wished the leader greater success in his work for defending the dignity and sovereignty of the nation and achieving the independent development and prosperity of the country and good health and happiness.

articles.title: Choe Won Ik dies
articles.content:
Greetings to Peruvian President 
    Pyongyang, June 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on June 6 sent a congratulatory message to Alejandro Toledo Manrique on his election as President of the Republic of Peru.
 The message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms, and sincerely wished the Peruvian President success in his future work for the national unity and the democratic development of the country.
